abstract: A significant political advertisement during World War One that encouraged a 'Yes' vote in a referendum on conscription in Australia.
description: Australian Prime Minister Billy Hughes delivers the 'Yes' case for conscription with a to-camera speech intercut with footage (superimposed with quotes from Hughes) covering fourteen 'Referendum Bullets' in support of his argument. The film urges support for Australian front-line troops while taking a swipe at 'shirkers' who would rather attend a horse race.
